Presenting Problem / Chief Complaint: The patient is experiencing stress related to moving and is seeking coping strategies for anxiety
History of Present Illness (HPI): The patient has been implementing self-care strategies, such as scheduling time for reading and practicing deep breathing exercises, which have contributed to better management of anxiety
Psychosocial History: The patient has engaged in open communication with her daughter, who expressed a need for emotional support, leading to improved sharing of feelings between them
Progress Evaluation: The patient has shown significant improvement in managing anxiety and is actively working on her relationship with her husband
Therapeutic Interventions: The patient is encouraged to practice grounding exercises to help manage anxiety
Next Steps: The patient plans to discuss scheduling a date night with her husband to reconnect
